00048 /**************************************************************************\
00049  *
00050  *  File:  phase1_preload.c
00051  *
00052  *  Description:
00053  *    Moves constant loading out of loops
00054  *
00055  *  Authors:  Sabrina Hwu and Rick Hank, University of Illinois
00056  *  Modified for Intel EM - Jim Pierce
00057  *
00058  *

00060 
00061 /* 10/29/02 REK Adding config.h */
00062 #include <config.h>
00063 #include "mia_internal.h"
00064 
00065 #undef DEBUG_CB_WEIGHT
00066 #undef DEBUG_PRELOAD
00067 
00068 #define ERR     stdout
00069 /*=========================================================================*/
00070 
00071 /*
00072  *      Also consider static weight that is
00073  *      determined by loop analysis.
00074  */
00075 #undef CONSIDER_STATIC_ESTIMATION
00076 
00077 /*
00078  *      We consider preloading from 1st level loops first.
00079  *      If they are too big, or not important enough,
00080  *      then consider preload higher level loops.
00081  *      1. if a loop is too large, then the life time
00082  *              of the preloaded constants would be too long,
00083  *              and due to the size, we expect many live registers.
00084  *      2. if a loop is not important enough, we don't want to
00085  *              add live-ranges, that may impede preloading for
00086  *              more important loops that are nested.
00087  */
00088 
00089 #define MAX_LOOP_NESTING                10
00090 
00091 #define MIN_LOOP_PRELOAD_WEIGHT         50.0
00092 #define MIN_LOOP_ITER_FOR_PRELOAD       2.0
00093 #define MAX_PRELOAD_CONST_PER_LOOP      16
00094 #define MAX_LOOP_SIZE_WITH_NESTED_LOOPS 16
00095 #define MAX_LOOP_SIZE_FOR_PRELOAD       32      /* basic blocks */
00096 
00097 /*
00098  *      We use two criteria to decide whether or not
00099  *      a constant should be preloaded.
00100  *      1. is it important enough.
00101  *      2. how many can we preload.
00102  */
00103 
00104 double Lconst_min_preload_weight = MIN_LOOP_PRELOAD_WEIGHT;
00105 int Lconst_max_preload_const_per_loop = MAX_PRELOAD_CONST_PER_LOOP;
00106 int Lconst_max_loop_size_with_nested_loops = MAX_LOOP_SIZE_WITH_NESTED_LOOPS;
00107 int Lconst_max_loop_size_for_preload = MAX_LOOP_SIZE_FOR_PRELOAD;
00108 
00109 static int
00110 need_preload (L_Oper * oper, L_Operand * operand, int src_num)
00111 {
00112   int val;
00113 
00114   switch (L_operand_case_type (operand))
00115     {
00116     case L_OPERAND_INT:
00117       val = operand->value.i;
00118       /* data operand of a store cannot be an immediate */
00119       if (L_store_opcode (oper))
00120         {
00121           if (src_num == 2)
00122             return (1);
00123           else
00124             return (0);
00125         }
00126       else if (L_cond_branch_opcode (oper))
00127         {
00128           if (SIMM_8 (val))
00129             return (0);
00130           else
00131             return (1);
00132         }
00133       else
00134         {
00135           if (SIMM_14 (val))
00136             return (0);
00137           else
00138             return (1);
00139         }
00140     case L_OPERAND_FLOAT:
00141       return (1);
00142     case L_OPERAND_DOUBLE:
00143       return (1);
00144     case L_OPERAND_STRING:
00145       return (1);
00146     case L_OPERAND_LABEL:
00147       if (L_subroutine_call_opcode (oper) && src_num == 0)
00148         return (0);
00149       else
00150         return (1);
00151     case L_OPERAND_CB:
00152       return (0);
00153     default:
00154       return (0);
00155     }
00156 }
00157 
00158 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00159 /* request */
00160 #define L_MAX_REQUEST   2048
00161 static int n_request = 0;
00162 static L_Oper *request_oper[L_MAX_REQUEST];
00163 static L_Operand **request_operand[L_MAX_REQUEST];
00164 
00165 /* the operation and operand that needs preload */
00166 static int n_preload = 0;
00167 static L_Operand preload_constant[L_MAX_REQUEST];
00168 static L_Operand *preload_register[L_MAX_REQUEST];
00169 static double preload_weight[L_MAX_REQUEST];
00170 static int preload[L_MAX_REQUEST];
00171 
00172 static void
00173 flush_preload_request ()
00174 {
00175   n_request = 0;
00176   n_preload = 0;
00177 }
00178 
00179 static void
00180 request_for_preload (L_Oper * oper, L_Operand ** operand)
00181 {
00182   int k;
00183   /*
00184    *  add a request.
00185    */
00186   k = n_request++;
00187   if (k >= L_MAX_REQUEST)
00188     L_punt ("L_constant_generation: too many requests");
00189   request_oper[k] = oper;
00190   request_operand[k] = operand;
00191   /*
00192    *  record the constant operand.
00193    */
00194   for (k = 0; k < n_preload; k++)
00195     {
00196       if (L_same_operand (&preload_constant[k], *operand))
00197         {
00198           preload_weight[k] += oper->weight;
00199           break;
00200         }
00201     }
00202   if (k == n_preload)
00203     {                           /* add an entry */
00204       k = n_preload++;
00205       preload_constant[k] = **operand;
00206       preload_weight[k] = oper->weight;
00207     }
00208 }
00209 
00210 /* global var n_preload */
00211 
00212 static void
00213 add_preload_code (L_Func * fn, L_Cb * preheader_cb)
00214 {
00215   struct Element list1[L_MAX_REQUEST], list2[L_MAX_REQUEST];
00216   L_Operand *reg_operand;
00217   int i;
00218   /*
00219    *  Decide what to preload.
00220    */
00221   for (i = 0; i < n_preload; i++)
00222     {
00223       list1[i].ptr = NULL;
00224       list1[i].weight = preload_weight[i];
00225       list1[i].index = i;
00226     }
00227   merge_sort (list1, list2, n_preload);
00228 
00229   for (i = 0; i < n_preload; i++)
00230     {
00231       int ctype, index = list2[i].index;
00232 
00233       if (list2[i].weight < Lconst_min_preload_weight)
00234         {
00235           preload[index] = 0;
00236         }
00237       else if (i >= Lconst_max_preload_const_per_loop)
00238         {
00239           preload[index] = 0;
00240         }
00241       else
00242         {
00243           preload[index] = 1;
00244 
00245           if (L_is_ctype_int_direct (preload_constant[index].ctype))
00246             ctype = L_CTYPE_LLONG;
00247           else if (L_is_ctype_float_direct (preload_constant[index].ctype))
00248             ctype = L_CTYPE_FLOAT;
00249           else if (L_is_ctype_double_direct (preload_constant[index].ctype))
00250             ctype = L_CTYPE_DOUBLE;
00251           else
00252             ctype = preload_constant[index].ctype;
00253 
00254           reg_operand = L_new_register_operand (++(fn->max_reg_id), ctype, 0);
00255 
00256           if (L_is_ctype_LOCAL_ABS_direct (ctype) ||
00257               L_is_ctype_LOCAL_GP_direct (ctype) ||
00258               L_is_ctype_GLOBAL_ABS_direct (ctype) ||
00259               L_is_ctype_GLOBAL_GP_direct (ctype))
00260             {
00261               L_assign_type_int_register (reg_operand);
00262             }
00263 
00264           preload_register[index] = reg_operand;
00265 
00266         }
00267     }
00268   /*
00269    *  Insert preload code in the loop preheader.
00270    */
00271   for (i = 0; i < n_preload; i++)
00272     {
00273       /*
00274        *  generate a mov operation.
00275        */
00276       int opcode = 0, ctype;
00277       L_Oper *oper;
00278 
00279       if (!preload[i])
00280         continue;
00281 
00282 #ifdef DEBUG_PRELOAD
00283       fprintf (ERR, "# preload ");
00284       L_print_operand (ERR, &preload_constant[i], 1);
00285       fprintf (ERR, " into ");
00286       L_print_operand (ERR, preload_register[i], 1);
00287       fprintf (ERR, "\n");
00288       fprintf (ERR, "preload weight = %f\n", preload_weight[i]);
00289 #endif
00290 
00291       ctype = preload_constant[i].ctype;
00292 
00293       if (L_is_ctype_integer_direct (ctype) ||
00294           L_is_ctype_LOCAL_ABS_direct (ctype) ||
00295           L_is_ctype_LOCAL_GP_direct (ctype) ||
00296           L_is_ctype_GLOBAL_ABS_direct (ctype) ||
00297           L_is_ctype_GLOBAL_GP_direct (ctype))
00298         {
00299           opcode = Lop_MOV;
00300         }
00301       else if (L_is_ctype_float_direct (ctype))
00302         {
00303           opcode = Lop_MOV_F;
00304         }
00305       else if (L_is_ctype_double_direct (ctype))
00306         {
00307           opcode = Lop_MOV_F2;
00308         }
00309       else
00310         {
00311           L_punt ("L_constant_generation: illegal ctype");
00312         }
00313 
00314       oper = L_create_new_op (opcode);
00315       /* assign the preload register operand created above to */
00316       /* the destination of the preload instruction, this way */
00317       /* I don't need to copy the operand, and I don't need   */
00318       /* to free it                                           */
00319       oper->dest[0] = preload_register[i];
00320       /* copy the operand containing the constant to be preloaded */
00321       oper->src[0] = L_copy_operand (&preload_constant[i]);
00322 
00323       /*
00324        *  Insert in the loop preheader.
00325        */
00326       L_insert_oper_after (preheader_cb, preheader_cb->last_op, oper);
00327 
00328 #ifdef DEBUG_PRELOAD
00329       fprintf (ERR, "# add ");
00330       L_print_oper (ERR, oper);
00331       fprintf (ERR, " to cb %d\n", preheader_cb->id);
00332 #endif
00333     }
00334 }
00335 
00336 static void
00337 replace_preload_operand ()
00338 {
00339   int i, k;
00340 
00341   for (i = 0; i < n_preload; i++)
00342     {
00343 
00344       if (!preload[i])
00345         continue;
00346 
00347       for (k = 0; k < n_request; k++)
00348         {
00349           if (L_same_operand (*request_operand[k], &preload_constant[i]))
00350             {
00351 #ifdef DEBUG_PRELOAD
00352               fprintf (ERR, "# change ");
00353               L_print_operand (ERR, *request_operand[k], 1);
00354               fprintf (ERR, " to ");
00355               L_print_operand (ERR, preload_register[i], 1);
00356               fprintf (ERR, " in oper %d\n", request_oper[k]->id);
00357 #endif
00358               L_delete_operand (*request_operand[k]);
00359               *request_operand[k] = L_copy_operand (preload_register[i]);
00360             }
00361         }
00362     }
00363 }
00364 
00365 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00366 static void
00367 preload_loop (L_Func * fn, L_Loop * loop)
00368 {
00369   int i, j, loop_cb[MAX_LOOP_SIZE_FOR_PRELOAD + 1], n_loop_cb;
00370 
00371   /*
00372    *  Decode which constants to be preloaded.
00373    */
00374   flush_preload_request ();
00375   n_loop_cb = Set_2array (loop->loop_cb, loop_cb);
00376   for (i = 0; i < n_loop_cb; i++)
00377     {
00378       L_Oper *oper;
00379       L_Cb *cb = L_cb_hash_tbl_find (fn->cb_hash_tbl, loop_cb[i]);
00380 
00381       for (oper = cb->first_op; oper != 0; oper = oper->next_op)
00382         {
00383           for (j = 0; j < L_max_src_operand; j++)
00384             {
00385               if (oper->src[j] == NULL)
00386                 continue;
00387 
00388               if (need_preload (oper, oper->src[j], j))
00389                 {
00390 #ifdef DEBUG_PRELOAD
00391                   fprintf (ERR, "# request preload of ");
00392                   L_print_operand (ERR, oper->src[j], 1);
00393                   fprintf (ERR, "\n");
00394 #endif
00395                   request_for_preload (oper, &oper->src[j]);
00396                 }
00397             }
00398         }
00399     }
00400 #ifdef DEBUG_PRELOAD
00401   fprintf (ERR, "# %d preload requests for loop %d\n", n_request, loop->id);
00402 #endif
00403   add_preload_code (fn, loop->preheader);
00404   replace_preload_operand ();
00405 }
00406 
00407 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00408 /*
00409  *      CONSTANT GENERATION.
00410  */
00411 void
00412 Mopti_constant_generation (L_Func * fn)
00413 {
00414   double ave_iter;
00415   int nest;
00416   if (fn->first_cb == NULL)
00417     return;
00418 
00419   /*
00420    *  Compute the weight of operations.
00421    *  Use both dynamic and static weights.
00422    */
00423 
00424   L_loop_detection (fn, 1);
00425   L_compute_oper_weight (fn, 1, 1);
00426 
00427   /*
00428    *  The entry block must not be a loop header.
00429    */
00430   if (fn->first_cb->src_flow != NULL)
00431     L_punt ("L_constant_generation: entry block must not be a loop header");
00432 
00433   /*
00434    *  Determine preload code for each loop structure.
00435    */
00436 
00437   for (nest = 1; nest < MAX_LOOP_NESTING; nest++)
00438     {
00439       /*
00440        *  Work from nesting level 1 up.
00441        */
00442       L_Loop *loop = fn->first_loop;
00443       for (; loop != NULL; loop = loop->next_loop)
00444         {
00445           L_Cb *preheader_cb, *header_cb;
00446           double preheader_weight, header_weight;
00447 
00448           /*
00449            *  Always start from the outer loop and go inward.
00450            */
00451           if (loop->nesting_level != nest)
00452             continue;
00453 
00454           /*
00455            *  Must fulfill the following condition.
00456            *  1. loop size < Lconst_max_loop_size_for_preload
00457            *  2. loop weight > Lconst_min_preload_weight
00458            *  3. if loop is a nested loop, if doesn't iterate enough, skip and
00459            *          preload outer loop.
00460            */
00461           preheader_cb = loop->preheader;
00462           header_cb = loop->header;
00463 
00464           preheader_weight = preheader_cb->weight + preheader_cb->weight2;
00465           header_weight = header_cb->weight + header_cb->weight2;
00466 
00467           ave_iter = (header_weight - preheader_weight) / preheader_weight;
00468 
00469 
00470 #ifdef DEBUG_PRELOAD
00471           fprintf (stderr, "Loop preheader = %d  header = %d\n",
00472                    preheader_cb->id, header_cb->id);
00473 
00474           fprintf (stderr, "preheader weight = %f %f\n",
00475                    preheader_cb->weight, preheader_cb->weight2);
00476 
00477           fprintf (stderr, "header weight = %f %f\n",
00478                    header_cb->weight, header_cb->weight2);
00479 
00480           fprintf (stderr, "ave_iter = %f  %f\n",
00481                    ave_iter, MIN_LOOP_ITER_FOR_PRELOAD);
00482 #endif
00483 
00484           if (ave_iter < MIN_LOOP_ITER_FOR_PRELOAD)
00485             continue;
00486 
00487           if (Set_empty (loop->nested_loops))
00488             {
00489               if (Set_size (loop->loop_cb) > Lconst_max_loop_size_for_preload)
00490                 continue;
00491             }
00492           else
00493             {
00494               if (Set_size (loop->loop_cb) >
00495                   Lconst_max_loop_size_with_nested_loops)
00496                 continue;
00497             }
00498 
00499           if (header_weight < Lconst_min_preload_weight)
00500             continue;
00501 
00502           /*
00503            *  Preload this loop now.
00504            */
00505           preload_loop (fn, loop);
00506         }
00507     }
00508 }
